title: Herpes Simplex Virus
Aetiology: DNA virus, HSV-1 ==> oral, HSV-2 ==> genital
Symptoms: Maternal ==> Oral, genital, disseminated. Neonatal ==> CNS, Dissmeinated, Skin, eye, mouth disease
Complications: Neonatal infection, 41% risk if primary leaison, 2% if recurrent. Transplacental infection is possible
Management: Primary infection ==> <26wks start aciclovir at 36wks, >26wks begin immediately. Delivery ==> EDD within 6wks then caesarean
